column3:
おおそうだ！
お前の働きぶり、ちょくちょく聞いてるぞ
これからも頑張れよ！
column4:
Oh yeah!
I've heard a lot about your work, Keep it up!

column3:
お前、すごい活躍なんだってな！
ちくしょー、さっき副隊長が
わざわざこれをお前にってよ
column4:
I heard you've been doing amazing work! 
Hell, just now the vice-captain specifically gave this to you.

column3:
ほら、持ってけ！
あーちくしょ～！　羨ましい！！
column4:
Here, take it!
Ah, damn it～!　I'm so jealous!

column3:
おうおう、頑張ってるみたいじゃないか！
お前には他のヤツよりちょっといい
支給品を回してやるよ
column4:
Oh, well, it looks like you're doing a great job!
I'm going to give you a little better allowance than the rest of them.

column3:
お疲れさん、忘れず顔を出したな
ほれ、今回の支給品だ
column4:
Good job, you didn't forget to show up.
Here, here's the latest supply.

column3:
よぉ！
よく来たな、噂の大型新人！
column4:
Hey there!
You've come at a good time, the rumored big shot rookie!

column3:
俺は砦北部のエリア、バートランド平原の
エリアマスターをしてるスケルツォ
――お前と同じ覚者だ
column4: I am Scherzo, the Area Master of the northern area, Betland Plains. I am an Arisen, just like you.

column3:
しかし困ったぞ――
憧れのヴァネッサ副隊長が信頼するレオ統率に
目をかけられてるお前――！
column4:
However, I'm in trouble--
You, who are being noticed by Leo, the commanding officer whom Lieutenant Vanessa admires and trusts!

column3: 俺にとっちゃあ、最大のライバル出現だ！
column4: For me, this is the biggest rivalry I've ever had!

column3: ――とまぁ、冗談はさておきよろしくな！
column4: -- and well, joking aside, nice to meet you!

column3:
ここのクエストボードは正門の中だ
バートランド平原の任務――
資源確保とオーク軍の勢力調査だ
column4:
The quest board here is inside the main gate.
Quests in the Betland Plains - securing resources and investigating the Orc army's strength.

column3:
そのうちお前にも頼むことになるだろうが
今すぐにってわけじゃない
なにせ危険地帯だからな
column4:
I'll have to ask you to do it eventually.
Not right now, though.
It's a dangerous zone, after all.

column3:
まずは、レオ統率や他のエリアマスター
から一目置かれる覚者になってくれよ
――あ、でも副隊長の前では控えめにな！
column4:
First, become an Arisen who is respected by Leo and other Area Masters. 
But, be modest in front of the Vice Captain!

column3:
お前の働きぶり、ちょくちょく聞いてるぞ
これからも頑張れよ！
column4:
I've heard a lot about your work,
keep up the good work!

column3:
ま、俺がお前のために直接してやれることは
支給くらいだけど
成果に応じていいもん手配してやるからさ！
column4: Well, the only direct thing I can do for you is to provide support, but I'll arrange something nice for you based on your results, so...!

column3: 一つ、不穏な情報が入ってるんだ
column4: There is one piece of unsettling information.

column3:
バートランド高地の監視塔近く、湖のほとり
《湖岸の廃墟》でコロッサスが出現するように
なったようでな
それもかなりの剛腕ぶりらしい
column4:
Near the observation tower in Betland Highlands, by the lake. 
A Colossus seems to have appeared at the Lakeside Ruins. 
And it seems to possess quite an impressive level of strength.

column3:
あそこはバートランド連絡路にも近いから
周囲を通る時は気をつけろ
もちろん、討伐してくれりゃ大助かりだ
column4:
Because there is a connecting channel to Betland nearby, be careful when passing through there. 
Of course, it would be a great help if you could subdue it.

column3:
おっ！　そうだ
お前に頼みたい任務があるんだ
column4:
Oh! That's right.
I have a mission that I want to ask of you.

column3:
《バートランド墓地》は知ってるか？
まぁ簡単に言えば、任務はその内部調査だ
column4: Do you know about Betland Cemetery? Well, to put it simply, the mission is to investigate its interior.

column3:
中の様子を見てみて
もし魔物がいたらその討伐！
――うんまぁ、あれだ、シンプルだろ？
column4:
Take a look inside and if there are demons, then defeat them!
--Yeah well, that's it, simple, right?

column3:
任務を受ける準備ができたら
あらためて声を掛けてくれ
column4: When you're ready to take on the assignment, give me a call again.

column3:
よぉよぉ！！　ブイブイ言わせてる
みたいじゃないか
新入りだと思ってたらあっという間だな
column4:
Hey, hey! 
You're really making waves, aren't you? 
I thought you were a newcomer, but time flies.

column3:
お前の働きに対して、報償が出たぞ
支給品の格上げだ
column4:
I have received compensation for your labor.
It is an upgrade of the supplies provided.

column3:
ま、それだけ戦果をあげたってわけだ
誇っていいぞ、うん
column4:
Well, that's how much you've accomplished in the war.
You can be proud of yourself, yeah.

column3:
要警戒情報が入ったぞ！
オークの本拠地に近い、平原北部――
《バートランド大橋》のたもとで、精鋭部隊らしき
オークの一団が目撃されたんだ
column4:
Alert! We have received important information.
In the northern part of the plain, near the Orc stronghold, underneath Betland Bridge, a group of elite Orcs has been sighted.

column3:
部隊が準備をしている間に
何とかしないと、また砦が攻め込まれない
とも限らない
column4:
While the unit is preparing, we must do something, or the fortress may be breached again.
There is no guarantee otherwise.

column3:
ヴァネッサ副隊長には報告済みだが
もし対処できそうなら、お前の方でも
よろしく頼む
column4: I have already reported it to Vice Captain Vanessa, but if you think you can address it, I also ask for your assistance.

column3:
バートランドのどこかには
モゴックの腹心《戦鬼ゲソム》が指揮する
部隊のアジトがあるって情報も入ってる
column4: Somewhere in Betland, there is information that Gesomu the War Demon, Mogok's right-hand man, commands a base for his unit.

column3: 引き続き調べる必要があるな
column4: I'll have to keep looking into this.

column3:
おお！　お前に連絡だ！
ついに奴らの本拠地、《バートランド平原北部》に
攻め込む手はずが整ったぞ
column4:
Oh! I've got news for you!
We have finally made arrangements to invade their stronghold, the Northern Betland Plains.

column3:
バートランド北部へと繋がる
山道を塞いでいた落石を、ようやく除去できたんだ
column4: We were finally able to remove the rocks that were blocking the mountain road that leads to northern Betland.

column3:
ま、そこが通れるようになったのはお互い様で
これでオークどもも、魔獣を使って山側から
侵入する必要なく、そのままこっちへ来れる
ようになったわけだが――
column4:
Well, we both made it possible to pass through there. 
Now those orcs can come over here without needing to invade from the mountain side using magic beasts.

column3:
ともあれ、隊を組んで奴らの居城
《ガルドノック砦》に乗り込む日も近いだろうな！
column4: Regardless, the day is approaching when we will go together and infiltrate their stronghold, Gardnox Fortress!

column3: よう、砦の任務は順調かい？
column4: Hey, how's the mission at the fortress going?

column3:
そ、そうだ！！　
良い所にきたな、お前にも言っておこう！
《禊の神殿》について新しい情報が入ってな
column4:
Oh, right!! 
You've come to a good place, so I'll tell you too! 
There's new information about the Temple of Purification.

column3:
神殿内部に、ずっと入れなかった
《不浄の地下水路》って区画があるんだ
もとは神殿に引いた湖の水を浄化する
区画だったんだが――
column4:
Inside the temple, there is a section called the "Defiled Waterway" that I have never been able to enter. 
It used to be a section for purifying the water from the lake that was drawn into the temple.

column3:
昔のエリアマスター、禊の神官長が
封鎖して立入禁止にしたんだよ
何があったか知らないけどな
column4:
The former area master, the priest in charge of purification, blocked off the area and prohibited entry. 
I don't know what happened though.

column3:
それがごく最近、その封鎖が
解けているのが発見されたんだ
column4: Very recently, that blockade was found to have been broken.

column3:
それに気づいた定期討伐の隊士は
妙な威圧感と寒気に襲われて
結局中まで入れなかったらしい
column4: The squad members who noticed it were ultimately unable to enter due to a strange sense of intimidation and coldness.

column3:
もしついでがあったら、確認しといてくれよ
オークはともかく、俺はこの手の話
苦手なんだよな――
column4:
If you happen to have some time, please check it for me.
As for orcs, I'm not really good with that kind of thing you know.

column3:
厳重警戒情報だ！
セラー湖の浜辺、《船墓場》で妙に強力な
ブルーニュートが現れたらしい
column4:
This is a serious warning!
It seems that a strangely powerful Blue Newt has appeared on the shore of Lake Cera, known as the "Ship Graveyard".

column3:
普通のヤツと区別して《レイクニュート》
と呼ぶことにしたんだが、どうやら
脅威はそれだけじゃないようでな
column4: I decided to call it "Lake Newt" to distinguish it from a regular one, but it seems that the threat is not just that.

column3:
ヤツらのいる付近で、巨大な影と水面を
横切るヒレを見たって隊士もいるんだ
column4: Near where they are, there are some members of the squad who have seen a giant shadow and a fin cutting through the water's surface.

column3:
セラー湖の怪物――
ヒレ以外の情報はなく、その報告をうけ
確認に行った奴も正体を掴んでいない
column4:
The Monster of Lake Cera-- 

Aside from its fins, there is no other information, and even those who went to confirm it have not grasped its true nature.

column3:
お前も十分注意しろよ
相当強力な魔物がいるに違いない
column4:
You be very careful too.
There must be some pretty powerful demons in there.

column3:
いやー、参った参った
まさかお前がここまですごいとはなぁ――
副隊長がベタ褒めするのもしょうがないか
column4:
Well, I'm impressed, I'm impressed. I didn't expect you to be this amazing. 
I guess even the Vice-Captain's over-the-top praise is understandable.

column3:
正直、お前がいなかったらこの砦は
オークに落とされてたかもしれん
俺も他のヤツも、それは解ってるツモリさ
column4:
Honestly, if you weren't here, this fortress might have been taken down by Orcs. 
Both me and the others know that.

column3:
さ、今度の特別報償だ
特級の支給を受けられるようしておいたぞ
胸を張って受け取れよ！
column4:
Well, this time it's a special reward.
I made sure you can receive a first-class payment.
Receive it with pride!

column3: これからもよろしくな！
column4: Thank you for your continued support!

column3:
お前に頼みたい任務があるんだ
今回は、特に重要な任務だ
column4:
I have a mission I need you to do for me.
It's a particularly important mission this time.

column3:
もしかしたら、ついに奴らオークの拠点
モゴックの腹心が潜んでいるらしい
《戦鬼の影穴》を潰せるかもしれん
column4: Maybe we can finally destroy the Orc stronghold where they say Mogok's henchmen lurk, "War Demons' Hideout".

column3:
すでに別の隊士が怪しい場所を
調べにいってるんだが、まだ戻らない
もしかしたら感づかれて
すでに殺されている可能性もある
column4:
Another soldier has already gone to investigate a suspicious location, but they haven't returned yet. 
However, they might have been noticed and possibly killed already.

column3:
そこで、お前にも危険を覚悟で
二次調査をしてもらいたいんだ
column4: Therefore, I would like you to conduct a secondary investigation, being prepared for danger.

column3:
この調査、なるはやで頼めないか？
準備ができたらまた声を掛けてくれ
column4:
Can you ask for this survey as soon as possible?
Call me again when you're ready.

column3:
俺は砦の庶務全般を担当してる
ま、要するに副隊長の小間使いだよ
column4:
I'm in charge of all the general affairs of the fort.
Well, in short, I'm the deputy commander's lackey.

column3:
体を鍛えて鍛えて、鍛えまくって！！
そのうち副隊長を振り向かせてやるのさ！
column4:
I'm going to work out, work out, work out!
One of these days I'm going to turn the vice captain around!

column3: あ、とるなよ！　それ俺のだから！
column4: Ah, don't take that! It's mine!

column3:
砦内の《クエストボード》にはな
調査や討伐以外に、ちょいちょい
副隊長じきじきの依頼があってな――
column4: On the "Quest Board" inside the fortress, there are not only investigations and subjugations, but also occasional requests directly from the vice captain.

column3:
そういえば、《辺境の礎》ってあるだろ？
アレ、基本的には覚者本人が触れないと
使えるようにならないんだがな
column4:
By the way, aren't there Sub Portcrystals? 
In general, they can't be used unless the Arisen themselves touch them.

column3:
ここら辺一帯でのお前の働きを評価して
バートランド平原にある《辺境の礎》全部が
使えるようにされたそうだ
column4: I heard that your efforts in this area have been evaluated, and now all of the Sub Portcrystals in the Betland Plains have been made available.

column3:
いや～、最近のお前の活躍っぷりは
すごかったからな！
column4:
No～, your recent successes have been
amazing!

column3:
ま、今回の《辺境の礎》の解放は
俺じゃなくて神殿のハカライってことになるんだが
俺もお前の実力はちゃーんと認めてるからな！
column4:
Well, the release of the "Sub Portcrystals" this time will be done by the Temple's official, not me.
But I also acknowledge your abilities properly, you know!

column3:
これからもブイブイ言わせてるお前を
楽しみにしてるぞ！
column4: I'm looking forward to seeing you continue to thrive!

column3:
よぉ、元気か？
ちょうどお前に頼みたいことがあったんだ
column4:
Hey, how you doing?
I just had a favor to ask you.

column3:
バートランド大橋の近くに
《薄煙の荒れ地》って呼ばれてる場所があるんだがな
column4: There is a place near Betland Bridge called the "Wispy Wasteland".

column3:
あそこは元からオークが
出没しやすいところだったんだが
最近、血の臭いに引き寄せられたのか
ガーゴイルまで飛び回り始めたんだ
column4:
That place has always been an easy spot for Orcs to appear.
Lately, they must have been attracted by the smell of blood, as Gargoyles have started flying around too.

column3:
知っての通り、やつら飛び回りながら
石化の呪いを吐きつけてくるだろ？
あれが思ったより厄介でなぁ
column4:
As you know, those guys are flying around and spitting out a curse of petrification, right?
That curse is more troublesome than I thought.

column3:
というわけで駆除を頼みたい
準備ができたら、また声をかけてくれ
column4:
So, I would like to request extermination services.
When you are ready, please let me know.

column3:
よ、よぉ――
え？　顔色が悪いって？
column4:
Yo, yo--
Huh? My complexion looks bad?

column3:
ちょっと気味の悪い話を聞いてな――
本当は聞きたくなかったんだが
エリアマスターとしてこの地域の情報は
全て把握しておかないといけないし――
column4:
Let me tell you a slightly eerie story――
I really didn't want to hear it, but as an Area Master, I must know all the information about this area.

column3:
ええい、道連れだ！
お前も聞いていけ！
column4:
Very well, come along!
You too, listen and go!

column3:
《罪人の修獄》って知ってるか？
あそこは獄死した罪人ばかりが
埋葬されていた地下墓場でな
column4: Do you know about the Penitentiary for Sinners? It's an underground cemetery where only sinners who died in prison are buried.

column3:
かなり前に使われなくなって閉鎖されたんだが
最近、いつの間にか鍵が――
開いてたそうだ――
column4:
It had been quite a while since it was last used and closed down, but recently, seemingly out of nowhere, the lock had been――
open――

column3:
いやぁ、俺はこの手の話は苦手なんだよ
獣やオークなら、俺の鍛えた筋肉と技で
何とかなるが
幽霊はそういう問題じゃないからな――
column4:
Well, I'm not good with this kind of talk. 
If it's about animals or orcs, I can handle it with my trained muscles and skills. 
But ghosts are a different problem, you know.

column3:
いいところに来てくれた！
人並み外れた度胸のある覚者
そう、正にお前を待ってたんだ！
column4:
You've come to a good place!
An Arisen with extraordinary courage!
Yes, I've been waiting just for you!

column3:
この前話しただろう
《罪人の修獄》の鍵が
いつの間にか開いてたって件でな
column4:
We talked about it before, right?
Regarding the lock to "Penitentiary," it seems it was somehow opened.

column3:
ほっとくわけにはいかないから
調査のために何人か人をやってみたんだ
column4: Because I can't just let it be, I tried assigning some people for the investigation.

column3:
そうしたら、案の定というか何というか
――出たんだとさ――
女の笑う声があちこちから聞こえてきたらしい
column4:
Well, as expected, or rather, just as I thought—
―― There it is ――
The sound of a woman's laughter seemed to be coming from various directions.

column3:
おれはそういうのはどうも苦手でな
こうなると、頼れるのはお前しかいない！
確かああいう類もイケるんだったよな？
column4:
I'm not very good at that kind of thing.
In this situation, the only one I can rely on is you!
I'm pretty sure that kind of thing is possible too, right?

column3:
今すぐに行ってくれとは言わない！
いや、言えない――
覚悟ができたら、あらためて声をかけてくれ
column4:
I'm not asking you to go now!
No, I can't tell you--
When you're ready, call on me again.

column3:
よぉよぉ！
お前の最近の活躍っぷりときたら
寝てても噂が耳飛び込んでくるくらいだぞ！
column4:
Hey hey!
Your recent achievements, I've been hearing about them even when I'm sleeping!
You're making quite a buzz, aren't you!

column3:
今までのお前の働きが評価されて
報酬が更に良い物になったから
楽しみにしておいてくれ！
column4:
Your previous efforts have been recognized, and as a result, your rewards have become even better. 
Please look forward to it!

column3:
共にこのグリッテン砦を、そして神殿を支えていこう
これからもよろしくな！
column4:
Let us support Fort Gritten and the Temple together. 
So, let us continue to work together from now on.

column3: 私に用か？
column4: You wanted to see me?

column3:
覚者隊としてここを守るのは神殿のため
だが、私個人の一番の理由は家族のためだ
お前はどうだ？
column4:
As the Arisen Corps, we protect this place for the sake of the Temple. 
However, my personal main reason is for the sake of my family. 
What about you?

column3:
白竜様がかつてのお力を取り戻せば
オーク共などすぐに退けられよう
そんな日が早く来るといいのだがな
column4:
If Lord White Dragon were to regain his former power, He would easily be able to repel the likes of the Orcs.
It would be great if that day comes soon.

column3:
まだ、この間のオークの臭いが残っているな
はぁ、鎧や髪にも染みつくようだ
column4:
I can still smell the orc smell from the other day.
Huh, it seems to seep into my armor and hair.

column3: フン――！　人――何用ダ？
column4: Hm--!　Man-- what do you want?

column3:
何の用で来たんダ？
貢ぎ物か？　それなら――あぁ――うム
話、聞いてやらんでもない
column4:
What brings you here?
A tribute, perhaps? Well then, ah... I suppose I wouldn't mind hearing your story.

column3:
あぁ――まったく――！
人、特に覚者ってヤツはいつもいつも――
ゴブリンと見るや剣を振りおって、あぁ忌々しイ！
column4:
Ah―― Good grief――!
People, especially the Arisen, are always――
Swinging their swords at Goblins, yes, how annoying!

column3:
だが、取り引きなら――悪くなイ
剣を向けるなら、外の魔物にするんだナ
で、とっとと出てってくれ
column4:
But if you're looking for a deal - not a bad one.
If you're going to point a sword at me, do it at the demon outside.
And get the hell out of here.

column3:
ここは我ガ城、収集の園
外の愚かなゴブリン、魔物にこの価値は
わからない――ダろ
column4:
This is our castle, the garden of collection.
The foolish goblins outside do not understand the value of this place, to the enemies of magic.

column3:
だけど――なぁ――人、覚者
お前、アレの価値はわかるナ？
なら交換、交換ダ
価値ある物とナ
column4:
However... hey... people, Arisen.
Do you understand the value of that thing?
If so, let's exchange, exchange.
With something of value.

column3:
おまえ、覚えてるぞ！　
魔物やっつけにきたか？
ゴブリンやっつけにきたか？
column4:
I remember, you know!
Did you come to defeat the monsters?
Did you come to defeat the goblins?

column3:
面倒だから仲良くしような
あれこれ、良くしてやるヨ
column4:
It's a hassle, so let's be friends.
This and that, I'll make it better.

column3: ウガ？
column4: Uga?

column3:
ググ――
王、欲しイ物集マラナイ
機嫌悪クナル

そういった存在が怒り、気を乱した時
生命力の集まる急所
《シークレットコア》を感知することもできるのです
column4:
An enormous monster with a strong vitality.
When such a being gets angry and loses 
control, they are able to sense the vital spot
where vitality gathers, the "Secret Core".

column3:
仲間、そして敵の生命を感じることは
本質的に同じこと
どちらも命に触れることであることを
ゆめゆめお忘れなきよう
column4:
Feeling the lives of both allies and enemies
is fundamentally the same thing.
Both involve touching upon life itself.
Please never forget that.

column3:
ふむ――、よろしいでしょう
貴方は既に癒し手たる資質をお持ちの様子
column4:
Hmmm... good to know.
You already have the makings of a healer.

column3:
《プリースト》として救いの道へ入り
癒しの術を学ぶのです
column4: You've chosen the path of a "Priest" to learn the ways of healing and salvation.

column3:
ほう――
より深き癒しの技を知りたいと
column4: Oh, you wish to learn deeper healing techniques, I see.

column3:
ですが今の貴方にはまだ
体得は難しいでしょう
column4: But it will still be difficult for you to master it now.

column3:
《プリースト》となり、道を歩むのです

神殿の訓練官に相談するとよいでしょう
column4:
Become a "Priest" and stay the course.
When you reach job level 18, you may want to consult with the Temple's Trainer.

column3:
貴方が基本を修めたと認められ
私への指導依頼が出されたのであれば
喜んで引き受けましょう
column4: If it has been recognized that you have mastered the basics and a request for guidance has been made to me, then I would be happy to accept it.

column3:
その時、再び私を訪ねてください
よき癒し手を目指すのです
column4: At that time, please visit me again as you strive to become a skilled healer.

column3:
数多の痛みに触れてきたようですね
そしてその中で、時に貴方は無力を
感じたはず
column4:
It seems like you have experienced a lot of pain.
And in those moments, there were times when you must have felt powerless.

column3:
では――
さらなる癒しの術を教えましょう
今の貴方になら扱えるでしょうから
column4:
Then-
Let me teach you another method of healing.
You should be able to handle it now.

column3:
――貴方が纏う気配、そして眼差し
今や貴方は私以上に多くの生死に
触れてきたのかもしれません
column4:
--The presence you wear, and the look in your eyes... 
Now, you may have touched more lives and deaths than I have!

column3:
貴方はもう、理解しているでしょう
《プリースト》とは生と死にもっとも親しき者
命の真実の姿を見つめ、求道する者
column4:
You probably already understand, don't you?
A "Priest" is one who is most familiar with life and death, gazing at the true nature of life, seeking the path.

column3:
よろしいでしょう
私が識る高次の術を授けましょう

column4:
Very well, then.
Allow me to bestow upon you the knowledge of advanced arts, with that, you should be able to come closer to the truth.

column3:
ジョブレベルは十分――
どうやらすでに癒し手として
初歩の心構えは身に付けたようですね
column4:
The job level is sufficient—
Seems like you've already acquired the basic mindset of being a healer.

column3:
さらにこの道を探求せんというので

column4: Furthermore, if you are searching for the pursuit of this path, I would be delighted to provide assistance.

column3:
ですがその前に、今の貴方の成長を
神殿の訓練官に報告しておくべきです
column4: But first, you should report your current growth to the temple trainer.

column3:
世話になった者に心を返すこともまた
新たな出発には大切なことですから
column4: Returning gratitude to those who have helped us is also an important aspect of embarking on a new journey.

column3:
この静かな聖堂にて祈りを捧げる毎日

真髄です
column4:
Every day, I offer prayers in this silent
holy sanctuary.
Peace and harmony lead to all healing. 
That is the essence.

column3:
古き癒しの術は、より深き痛みを知らねば
真に体得することは難しいでしょう
column4:
If one does not truly understand the depths
of pain, it will be difficult to truly master 
the ancient healing arts of old.

column3:
貴方はもう少し俗世にて、自身のあり様を

column4:
Please take a moment to look at your 
own state a little more in the secular world.

column3:
ポーンの魂の姿――

column4:
The appearance of the soul of the Pawn.
When I can find that answer, 
I feel like I'm getting closer to true salvation.

column3:
かつて猛威を振るった赤色病も

column4: The Red Blight, which once wielded great devastation, is now a disease that has been eradicated.

column4: Time is generally a cruel thing, but well, it does have its good moments too.

May the blessings of The White Dragon
be with you, Arisen.

なんなりと

party members, please do not hesitate 
to ask.

非常に興味深い

On the ground, it is said that alchemy has been lost. 
I am very interested in how to make medicine and control enemies with alchemy.

錬金術についてより深く識りたいのであれば

column4: If you wish to deepen your understanding of alchemy, it would be wise to seek guidance from Lord Theodor.

column4: If it is something prohibited in your world, I will not recommend it.

column4:

It must be just a passing thought.

column3: 地上の者よ、よくぞ訪れました
column4: Ground beings, you have done well to come here.

column3:
時には休養を取るも大事、無理はなさいませんよう
貴方の滞在は実に喜ばしいこと
対価は求めません

Taking rest occasionally is important, please don't push yourself too hard.
Your presence is truly delightful.
I don't seek any compensation.

column4: Yes

column4: No

滅びが訪れる前に
また貴方の顔を見られて嬉しく思います
column4: Ground dwellers, before destruction arrives, I will be happy to see your face again.

column3:
たとえ理が――
この世が滅びようとも
貴方から受けた恩は忘れません
column4: Even if the order is lost, even if this world crumbles, I will not forget the kindness I received from you,

column3:
終わりの見えない苦難の中にあろうと
再びレスタニア、そして神殿と
繋がりを持つことができた
それだけで十分と思えるようになりました
column4:
In the midst of endless hardships, I was able to once again connect with Lestania, and with the Temple.
That alone became enough to me.

column3:
良いのです
考える時間は、もう十分に与えられました
column4: It's good. You have been given enough time to ponder.

column3:
以前よりメルゴダを実質的に支配していたのは
残念な事にディアマンテスです
column4: Unfortunately, Diamantes has been effectively dominating Mergoda more than before.

column3:
かの者の力は強大で恐ろしく、そして鋭い
身体を封じたとはいえ、その支配力まで抑える
ことは私達にはできませんでした
column4:
The power of that person is immense and terrifying, and also sharp. 
Even though their body was sealed, we were unable to suppress their control.

column3: 錬金の徒として、申し訳なく思います
column4: As a student of alchemy, I apologize.

column3:
テオドール様は地上にいらっしゃった時も
ディアマンテスの動向を常に注視しておられました
column4: Lord Theodor always closely monitored Diamantes' movements, even when he was on the surface.

column3:
しかしまさか、王を竜へ変じるなど――
そのような大それた事、私達の誰一人として
想像だにしなかったのです
column4: However, none of us could have imagined something as outrageous as the king transforming into a dragon.

column3:
覚者であり王であるゴルゴラン様が――
よもや、白竜様を裏切るなど――
column4:
Lord Golgorran, who is both an Arisen and a King—
Could it be that he would betray even the White Dragon—

column3:
今私達がこのように在るのは
人の理を持ち得て世の理を越えようとした
その罰なのかもしれませんね
column4: The reason we exist like this now might be a punishment for trying to surpass the principles of humanity and the world's order.

column3:
地上の覚者よ
よくぞいらしてくださいました
column4:
Arisen of the surface,
Thank you very much for coming.

column3:
私は当地のエリアマスター
ベアトリクスと申します
column4: I am the Area Master of this region. My name is Beatrix.

column3:
当年、２７歳になるはずですが
この地の時間がどう流れたのかわからず
困惑しておりますが――
column4: I should be turning 27 this year, but I am at a loss as to how time has passed on this surface.

column3:
ともあれ、ひさしぶりの来訪者ゆえ
至らぬ点、あらかじめお詫びさせて頂きます
column4: At any rate, I apologize in advance for any imperfections, as it has been a long time since we had a visitor.

column3:
加えて、３２３年前――
メルゴダの大多数の住民は白竜様を思って
祈りを捧げたこと――
column4: In addition, 323 years ago, the majority of Mergoda's residents prayed to the White Dragon.

column3:
黄金の竜でもディアマンテスでもなく
白竜様のご無事を願ったこと――
それだけはどうかお知りおきください
column4:
Not the Golden Dragon, nor Diamantes, but prayers for the safety of the White Dragon, Lord.
Please know this, above all else.

column3: メルゴダでの滞在はいかがですか？
column4: How about staying in Mergoda?

column3:
多少は力となれるよう
物資面で協力いたしましょう
column4: We can be of some help with supplies.

column3:
このメルゴダにはいくつか
ディアマンテスに与する者の住居が
残っています
column4: In this Mergoda there remain several residences of those who gave to Diamantes.

column3:
彼らの研究を凍結するため
封印している住居があるのですが
そこに何か、我らにとって有用なものが
あるかもしれません
column4: There is a residence where their research has been frozen solidly sealed. There may be something useful to us there.

column3:
住居の場所を教えましょう
そちらの方も、ぜひ探索を
column4: Let me tell you the location of your residence. Please consider exploring it.

column3:
レスタニアの覚者――
王ゴルゴランが、あなたのようであったなら――
column4: Arisen of Lestania, if only King Golgorran were like you...

その事に感謝いたしましょう
column4:

I am grateful for you visiting here now.
Let us express our gratitude for that fact.

column3: 私達も、あなたに何を返せるか考えねば

column3:
メルゴダにあなたが来られてしばらく――

column4: Have you been able to get used to this land since you came to Mergoda a while ago?

もし、その気がおありでしたら覚者よ

column4:
If you are interested, Ser Arisen,
How about receiving guidance from Lord Theodor, to advance further on the profound path of Alchemy?

column3:
錬金術は、善く使えば人が理を

column3:
地上の覚者であるあなたに
正しい姿を知って貰ってこそ
我らの想いも伝わるというもの
column4:
To you, who are an Arisen on surface,
Only by knowing the true form can our feelings be conveyed.

column3:
――その意思があるのでしたら
テオドール様にお話を
column4: If you have such intentions, please speak with Lord Theodore.

どれほど励みとなりましょう

O surface one--
how encouraging is the strength you lend to us.

column3:

column4: We have prepared a gift for you. Please continue to assist Mergoda.

a Synthetic Eye and a Synthetic Alchemized Goblin.

column4: Please, continue to assist Mergoda. We have prepared a gift for you.

既にご存知でしょう
column4:
There is something I want to tell you.
You may already know that "Sub Portcrystals" have been set up in various places.

column3:
ここメルゴダの王宮層に設置された礎も
このたび自動解放されたとのことです
column4: The Portcrystal that was installed in the palace layer of Mergoda is said to have been automatically released.

column3:
――礎が新たに設置されるということは
神殿は我々を見放してはいない
そう考えても、よいのでしょうか――
column4: Is it alright to think that the establishment of a new Portcrystal means that the Temple has not abandoned us?

column3: 地上の覚者よ、力を貸してください
column4: Arisen of the surface, please lend me your power.

column3:
古き住居に、ディアマンテスの思想に
染まった者の残党が
密かに集まっているのです
column4: Secretly gathering in an old dwelling are the remnants of those stained by the ideology of Diamantes.

column3:
彼らが何かよからぬ企てをしていることに
まず間違いはないでしょう
column4: There is no doubt that they are up to something nefarious.

column3:
どうか、彼らの企てを
未然に防いでいただけないでしょうか
column4: Could you please prevent their plot from happening in advance?

column3:
引き受けてくださるのであれば
礼も用意いたしましょう
column4: If you are willing to take on the task, we will prepare tokens of appreciation.

column3: 少し昔話をさせてください
column4: Could you please allow me to share a little old tale?

column3: かつて、とても優秀な女性技師がいたのです
column4: There once was a very talented woman engineer.

column3:
しかし、彼女はある日を境に
急速にディアマンテスに傾倒してゆき
周囲の人々とも距離を置きました
column4: However, she gradually became obsessed with Diamantes and one day distanced herself from the people around her.

column3:
今や行方も知れぬ彼女は
何故か、とある井戸に
頻繁に出入りしていたとのこと――
column4: Now, she, whose whereabouts are unknown, for some reason, frequented a certain well.

column3:
そこに何があるのかは誰も知りませんが
もしかすると有用なものも
あるかもしれません
column4: Nobody knows what is there, but there might be something useful.

column3:
あなたに場所を教えておきましょう
興味があれば覗いてみるも良いでしょう
column4: Let me tell you the location. If you are interested, it would be good to take a look.

column3: 地上の覚者よ、深刻な状況です
column4: Surface's Arisen, it is a serious condition.

column3:
《秘匿の実験場》にて
強力な何かの気配が感知されました
休眠状態にあった機関が
活動を再開したようなのです
column4:
At the "Secret Proving Ground," a powerful presence has been detected.
It seems that the dormant facility has resumed its activity.

column3:
正体まではわかりませんが
放置すれば災いの種となるでしょう
どうかあなたのお力をお貸しください
column4:
I don't understand the true nature, but if left alone, it will become a source of disaster.
Please lend me your assistance.

column3:
地上の覚者よ、感謝します
あなたが訪れてくださるようになり
ここメルゴダも何かが変わり始めたように思います
column4: Arisen of the surface, I am grateful. It seems that something has started to change here in Mergoda, as you have started visiting.

column3:
あなたの訪れにより
全てから切り離された私達に
新たな流れが運ばれてきたのです
column4: By your visit, to us who have been completely disconnected from everything, a new current has been brought.

column3:
私達も、あなたに何を返せるか考えねば――
せめて補給面だけでも
一層の助けとなりますよう尽力いたしましょう
column4:
We must also think about what we can give back to you—
At least in terms of supplies,
We will do our best to be of further assistance.

column3:
地上の覚者よ
私達にできる協力であれば
惜しむことはありません
column4:
Arisen of the surface,
If there is any aid we can provide, There is no need to hesitate.

column3:
地上の覚者よ
深刻な事態となりましたね
column4:
Arisen of the surface.
A serious situation has occurred, hasn't it?

column3: 学びとは、理を追求すること――
column4: The pursuit of order is what learning is all about.

column3: 錬金
column4: Alchemized

column3:
道を誤った私達ですが
常に理を追い求めてきたと自負しています
どうか、この世の理を破壊させないでください
column4:
We may have lost our way, but we have always prided ourselves on constantly pursuing order.
Please, do not destroy the order of this world.

column3:
ここメルゴダにて長きを過ごしてきたのは
今考えてみると
むしろ喜ばしいことかもしれません
column4: I spent a long time here in Mergoda, and now that I think about it, it might actually be something to be happy about.

column3:
ここにいたからこそ、この事態に
あなたを支えられるのですから
column4: Because I was here, that's why I am able to support you in this situation.

column3:
体力の回復、物資の補給――
どうか協力させてください
存分に、このメルゴダをお使いください
column4:
Please cooperate with me in recovering our stamina and replenishing our supplies. 
Please use Mergoda to the fullest extent possible.

column3:
錬魔達はディアマンテスの傀儡
我らとて、もはやここでは狩られる身
column4:
The Alchemists are puppets of Diamantes.
We, too, are now hunted here.

column3:
幸いにもテオドールの塔には制御杭が
仕込まれているから、錬魔達はこの周囲へ
入れないがな
column4: Fortunately, Theodor's tower has control stakes embedded in it, so the magic practitioners cannot enter this vicinity.

column3:
術杭と錬成した魔物を、我々は錬魔と呼ぶ
騎士団より便利に仕える兵として
ディアマンテスらが生み出した哀れな半生命だ
column4:
We call the monsters created by Diamantes through alchemy "Alchemized".
They are pitiful semi-life forms created to serve the knight order conveniently.

column3:
あやつがそんな研究をしたのも
溶命炉を悪しきことに使ったのも
全てあの男一人が始めたことなのか――
column4: Is it all because of that man, who conducted such research, who also used the Furnace for evil purposes?

column3:
地上か――
戻れるなら戻りたいものだ
column4:
On the ground, perhaps--
If I could go back, I would want to return.

column3:
だが、異なる時を歩み過ぎた我々に
果たして行き場はあるのだろうか
column4: However, for us who have walked through different times, Is there really a place to go?

column3: うむ、何か用でも？
column4: Yes, may I help you with something?

column3:
王宮層の《メルガン・アルケミデア》は
錬金術研究の高等研究室だ
column4: The upper level of the royal palace is the advanced laboratory of Alchemized research, Mergan Alchemium.

column3:
ディアマンテス派の術師の中には
まだそこで錬魔研究をしている者も
いるようだ
column4: Among the practitioners of the Diamantes faction, there still seem to be those who are conducting alchemy research there.

column3:
何の研究をしているかは不明だが
嫌な予感がする――
column4: I have no idea what research they are conducting, but I have a bad feeling about it.
